title: Small Edge Sets Meeting All Triangles of a Graph
main_result: Tuza holds for 4-colorable and triangle-3-colorable graphs

lemmas.name: tuza_4colorable
lemmas.statement: theorem tuza_4colorable (G : SimpleGraph V) (h : chromaticNumber G ≤ 4) : triangleCoveringNumber G ≤ 2 * trianglePackingNumber G
implications: Must contain K5 minor or equivalent

lemmas.name: tuza_triangle_3_colorable
lemmas.statement: theorem tuza_triangle_3_colorable (G : SimpleGraph V) (h : isTriangle3Colorable G) : triangleCoveringNumber G ≤ 2 * trianglePackingNumber G

lemmas.name: tuza_4partite
lemmas.statement: theorem tuza_4partite (G : SimpleGraph V) (h : is4Partite G) : triangleCoveringNumber G ≤ 2 * trianglePackingNumber G

lemmas.name: tuza_oddwheel_free
lemmas.statement: theorem tuza_oddwheel_free (G : SimpleGraph V) (h : isOddWheelFree G) : triangleCoveringNumber G ≤ 2 * trianglePackingNumber G

lemmas.name: triangle_3_colorable_recognition_hard
lemmas.english: Cannot efficiently test if a graph is triangle-3-colorable
implications: This property is not easily checkable

key_insight: Triangle-3-colorability (edge 3-coloring where each triangle gets distinct colors) implies Tuza. 4-colorable graphs are triangle-3-colorable.
notes: Important structural result - constrains counterexample heavily
